channel.title: SoundCloud mobile website buggy?
channel.description:
Anyone have trouble using SoundCloud on mobile/tablet/iOS?
Whenever I visit using Chrome browser (not the app) on my iPad, I find that important bits of the interface don’t work. (I often prefer the website version to the app, because they don’t support viewing or leaving comments in the app.)
E.g. menu/nav links don’t work and, critically, tracks don’t load/play.
Only if I switch using ‘request desktop version’ do things start working.
Just me?
  (I find it astounding that a major brand/company like SC are rolling with a mobile version of their hugely popular site that’s critically broken.)

item.title: SoundCloud mobile website buggy?
item.dc:creator: lowey
item.description:
I find the desktop site is buggy as hell too. Today I wanted to add 3 songs to a playlist, I ended up having to do parts of the task on the desktop and parts on the app on my phone as the desktop version would only let me add 1 song to 1 new playlist. Couldn’t add more tracks to the playlist once created, and “add to playlist” on a song would only let me create a new playlist (not add to an existing playlist). So I had to create the playlist, then add songs through the app, then edit the details of the playlist on the desktop.

Not what you would call a good user experience.

The app strips out important functionality, and it has a tendency to get stuck playing a song while claiming no song is playing, and then refuse to behave again until it’s force-quitted and restarted. Not to mention the ad that gets awkwardly inserted after every other song.

item.title: SoundCloud mobile website buggy?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
I have the app, but I only use it when in pure playing mood.
The app is quite stripped down, and they’ve stripped out things I like to see/use, like comments.

Additionally, things are mixed up in the app.
On the site, a person’s profile/homepage will include their own tracks as well as reposts they’ve made.

To see just that person’s tracks, you go to Tracks.

In the app, the Tracks screen shows everything, including reposts they’ve done.
There’s no screen listing just that person’s tracks.

It’s actually a bit of a mess/joke, especially for a company of that size.
